DataElement.preferredName: Pathology Tissue Specimen Membrane Stain Neoplasm Cell Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a fraction with the denominator 100 representing a quantity of cells from a sample of tissue or body fluid dyed for microscopic assessment of disease by a specialist in cellular function and changes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pathology Tissue Specimen Membrane Stain Neoplasm Cell
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the tumor cells identified by dye applied to the surface covering the outside of cells during microscopic assessment of a sample of tissue by a specialist in cellular function and changes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A specialty concerned with the nature and cause of disease as expressed by changes in cellular or tissue structure and function caused by the disease process. (MSH98):is an organ part that consists of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to specific spatial relationships; together with other tissues, it constitutes an organ component. Example(s): epithelium, muscle(tissue), connective tissue, neural tissue, lymphoid tissue.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A thin sheet or layer of pliable tissue, serving as a covering or envelope of a part, as the lining of a cavity, as a partition or septum, or to connect two structures.:A dye or other coloring material that is used in microscopy to make structures visible.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.:The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

Concepts.definition: A thin sheet or layer of pliable tissue, serving as a covering or envelope of a part, as the lining of a cavity, as a partition or septum, or to connect two structures.
A dye or other coloring material that is used in microscopy to make structures visible.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Pathology Specimen Stain Cell Percentage Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a fraction with the denominator 100 representing a quantity of cells from a sample of tissue or body fluid dyed for microscopic assessment of disease by a specialist in cellular function and changes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: revised to change Rep term due to change in Rep term set
